content.description:
Up the face. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber. 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2014. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).
content.protection: Top-Rope only. Likely requires a long static line.
content.location: About one third of the way across from White Lightning toward Frog Spit.

content.description:
Start about ten feet from left end of wall. Up some left-leaning cracks, finish at one-foot-wide tree at top of wall. 

Variation: Start directly under the big tree (left from bottom of cracks). Climb straight up to rejoin main route. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber. 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2014. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).
content.location: About ten feet from left end of wall. See Area directions for Swamp King.

content.description:
Up the crack, then figure out what to do with the tree obstructing the top.   (? much harder if do not use the tree ?) 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber. 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2014. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).
content.protection: Top-Rope only. Likely requires long static line.
content.location: A crack leaning slightly right-ward. About five feet right of Crimp Crack, with a foot-wide tree fallen down over it.

content.description:
Up to the two left-leaning cracks, finish at the small tree. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber. 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2014. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).
content.protection: Top-Rope only. Likely need long static line.
content.location: In the right half of the wall. Two left-leaning cracks one above the other, with a small tree at the top.

content.description:
Up the face. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber. 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2014. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).
content.protection: Top-Rope only. Likely requires a long static rope.
content.location: About two-thirds of the way across from White Lightning toward Frog Spit.   (see Area description for Swamp King wall)

content.description:
Straight up the crack. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber. 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2014. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).
content.protection: Top-Rope only. Likely requires long static line.
content.location: Straight thin crack three feet right from Frog Spit.    (See Area directions for Swamp King).

content.description:
Up the arete at left end of the wall, starting from its right side. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber. 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2014. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).
content.protection: Top-Rope only. Likely requires a long static line.
content.location: Left end of wall - (see Area directions for Swamp King wall)

content.description:
Nice slab climbing in the 5.7 to 9+ range, on Top-Rope with a long static line.    Shady pleasant environment (when it's dry). Page 89 in the 2011 Crefeld guidebook 2nd edition. But ... 

  Small, not much more than 20 feet high, and (as of 2014) needs some cleaning. Go there when you're sure it's dry, otherwise the base would likely be "swampy". 

  Top of the less-than-vertical wall has a nice well-defined edge for setting up top-ropes, but not many Trad gear placements near that edge, so best to have a long static line (50 feet / 15 meters) for most of the routes. 

  Many potential holds have moss on them or nearby, so might want to bring a brush or other tools for cleaning -- but lots of fun interesting moves even as it is (in 2014).
